description: A contact pointâ€”for example, a Customer Complaints department.
comment: Model 'ContactPoint' from Schema.org. See https://schema.org/ContactPoint. For use as component in other interfaces

contents.name: additionalType
contents.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

contents.name: areaServed
contents.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided. Supersedes serviceArea.
contents.comment: Schema.org Type: AdministrativeArea or GeoShape or Place or Text

contents.name: availableLanguage
contents.description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also inLanguage

contents.name: contactOption
contents.description: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

contents.name: contactType
contents.description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

contents.name: productSupported
contents.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").
